availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas Earls (Pendleton County, KY, farmer and miller)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, miller and farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Margaret Earls. Married to Elizabeth Earls. Father of Delila Earls, Margaret Earls, John Earls, Sarah E. Earls, Joseph N. Earls, William J. Earls, Abel D. Earls, Jonathan C. Earls, and James N. Earls. Farmer in Pendleton County in 1850. Miller in Pendleton County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, District 2, p. 340A-B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, p. 465.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, Cordova Precinct, p. 495A.
